ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Basic Spanish
I learned how to read, write, speak, and understand Spanish, and I went from having zero experience to being able to have basic conversations and read easy texts.
Speaking skills.
I learned about many different Spanish speaking countries while developing language skills.
I learned so much in this class! I went from not being able to form a coherent sentence to being able to hold a conversation, write stories, and read a short book in Spanish!
Pretty standard intro language class--practiced reading, writing, speaking, and listening.
Basic grammar and vocab.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
Strengths - it's a fine intro Spanish course
Weaknesses- mostly you're supposed to learn at home with little in class teaching of concepts, grading can be weird and skew things in a way that doesn't feel accurate to the classes work
I retained most of what I learned and remembered a lot of the vocabulary and grammar we went over since I used it regularly in class and got a lot of chances to improve them.
Weakness was the linguameeting.
There was a lot of engagement and communication between everybody. However, one weakness is how fast you start to speak Spanish. It can be confusing without any prior knowledge.

The strengths was the pace, it was good to meet and practice every day, and also the activities in class which were always fun and interactive! It sometimes went a little fast though and I wish we had more time to practice grammar and vocabulary.

In-person class conversations were very engaging and helpful.  The small class size and organization of the course encourages collaboration and a space where it's okay to make mistakes and learn.  Pretty consistent amount of work every week.  Linguameetings (that we had to pay for) were not very helpful and didn't really fit with the course.

Strengths: Very structured.
Weaknesses: Not very interactive.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you're looking to take Spanish then yes you have to. But if you're just taking it for fun maybe not.
Yes, the course is taught well and does a good job of covering all the basic concepts in Spanish, and the class is rewarding if you put in the work to improve your Spanish skills.
Yes if they want to learn Spanish.
Yes. It is well taught and our class had a great atmosphere.
Yes I would! It was a great positive environment, I learned so much, and had fun every class!
Yes, it's a well taught and organized intro language class.
Yes, good language to know.
